abstract: From June through September, New Yorkers called 73 complaints in to 311 to report rotten smells wafting from wastewater treatment plants, the lowest number since the city began tracking the complaints in 2002.
snippet: From June through September, New Yorkers called 73 complaints in to 311 to report rotten smells wafting from wastewater treatment plants, the lowest number since the city began tracking the complaints in 2002.
lead_paragraph: Summer in the city was hot and sweaty this year, but, judging by a steep decline in sewage odor complaints, not so stinky.

headline.main: In Case You Didn't Notice: Sewage Odors Are Drawing Fewer Complaints
